intro: Maytenus capitata, commonly known as the white-flowered mayten, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate, with a glossy surface. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds.
